verses.verse: The word<WH1697> that came<WH1961> to Jeremiah<WH3414> from the LORD,<WH3068> after<WH310> that Nebuzaradan<WH5018> the captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> had let him go<WH7971> from Ramah,<WH7414> when he had taken<WH3947> him being bound<WH631> in chains<WH246> among<WH8432> all<WH3605> that were carried<WH1546> away captive<WH1546> of Jerusalem<WH3389> and Judah,<WH3063> which were carried<WH1540> away captive<WH1540> to Babylon.<WH894>

And the captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> took<WH3947> Jeremiah,<WH3414> and said<WH559> to him, The LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> has pronounced<WH1696> this<WH2063> evil<WH7451> on this<WH2088> place.<WH4725>

Now the LORD<WH3068> has brought<WH935> it, and done<WH6213> according as he has said:<WH1696> because<WH3588> you have sinned<WH2398> against the LORD,<WH3068> and have not obeyed<WH8085> his voice,<WH6963> therefore this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> is come<WH1961> on you.

And now,<WH6258> behold,<WH2009> I loose<WH6605> you this day<WH3117> from the chains<WH246> which<WH834> were on your hand.<WH3027> If<WH518> it seem<WH5869> good<WH2896> to you to come<WH935> with me into Babylon,<WH894> come;<WH935> and I will look<WH7760> well to you: but if<WH518> it seem<WH5869> ill<WH7489> to you to come<WH935> with me into Babylon,<WH894> forbear:<WH2308> behold,<WH7200> all<WH3605> the land<WH776> is before<WH6440> you: where<WH413> it seems<WH5869> good<WH2896> and convenient<WH3477> for you to go,<WH3212> thither<WH8033> go.<WH3212>

Now while he was not yet<WH5750> gone<WH7725> back,<WH7725> he said, Go<WH7725> back<WH7725> also to Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> the son<WH1121> of Shaphan,<WH8227> whom<WH834> the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> has made governor<WH6485> over the cities<WH5892> of Judah,<WH3063> and dwell<WH3427> with him among<WH8432> the people:<WH5971> or<WH176> go<WH3212> wherever<WH413> <WH3605> it seems<WH5869> convenient<WH3477> to you to go.<WH3212> So the captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> gave<WH5414> him victuals<WH737> and a reward,<WH4864> and let him go.<WH7971>

Then went<WH935> Jeremiah<WH3414> to Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> to Mizpah;<WH4708> and dwelled<WH3427> with him among<WH8432> the people<WH5971> that were left<WH7604> in the land.<WH776>

Now when all<WH3605> the captains<WH8269> of the forces<WH2428> which<WH834> were in the fields,<WH7704> even they and their men,<WH582> heard<WH8085> that the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> had made Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> governor<WH6485> in the land,<WH776> and had committed<WH6485> to him men,<WH582> and women,<WH802> and children,<WH2945> and of the poor<WH1803> of the land,<WH776> of them that were not carried<WH1540> away captive<WH1540> to Babylon;<WH894>

Then they came<WH935> to Gedaliah<WH1436> to Mizpah,<WH4708> even Ishmael<WH3458> the son<WH1121> of Nethaniah,<WH5418> and Johanan<WH3110> and Jonathan<WH3129> the sons<WH1121> of Kareah,<WH7143> and Seraiah<WH8304> the son<WH1121> of Tanhumeth,<WH8576> and the sons<WH1121> of Ephai<WH5778> the Netophathite,<WH5200> and Jezaniah<WH3153> the son<WH1121> of a Maachathite,<WH4602> they and their men.<WH582>

And Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> the son<WH1121> of Shaphan<WH8227> swore<WH7650> to them and to their men,<WH582> saying,<WH559> Fear<WH3372> not to serve<WH5647> the Chaldeans:<WH3778> dwell<WH3427> in the land,<WH776> and serve<WH5647> the king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> and it shall be well<WH3190> with you.

As for me, behold,<WH2005> I will dwell<WH3427> at Mizpah,<WH4708> to serve<WH5975> <WH6440> the Chaldeans,<WH3778> which<WH834> will come<WH935> to us: but you, gather<WH622> you wine,<WH3196> and summer<WH7019> fruits, and oil,<WH8081> and put<WH7760> them in your vessels,<WH3627> and dwell<WH3427> in your cities<WH5892> that you have taken.<WH8610>

Likewise<WH1571> when all<WH3605> the Jews<WH3064> that were in Moab,<WH4124> and among the Ammonites,<WH5984> and in Edom,<WH123> and that were in all<WH3605> the countries,<WH776> heard<WH8085> that the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> had left<WH5414> a remnant<WH7611> of Judah,<WH3063> and that he had set<WH6485> over<WH5921> them Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> the son<WH1121> of Shaphan;<WH8227>

Even all<WH3605> the Jews<WH3064> returned<WH7725> out of all<WH3605> places<WH4725> where<WH834> <WH8033> they were driven,<WH5080> and came<WH935> to the land<WH776> of Judah,<WH3063> to Gedaliah,<WH1436> to Mizpah,<WH4708> and gathered<WH622> wine<WH3196> and summer<WH7019> fruits very<WH3966> much.<WH3966>

Moreover Johanan<WH3110> the son<WH1121> of Kareah,<WH7143> and all<WH3605> the captains<WH8269> of the forces<WH2428> that were in the fields,<WH7704> came<WH935> to Gedaliah<WH1436> to Mizpah,<WH4708>

And said<WH559> to him, Do you certainly know<WH3045> that Baalis<WH1185> the king<WH4428> of the Ammonites<WH5984> has sent<WH7971> Ishmael<WH3458> the son<WH1121> of Nethaniah<WH5418> to slay<WH5221> <WH5315> you? But Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> believed<WH539> them not.

Then Johanan<WH3110> the son<WH1121> of Kareah<WH7143> spoke<WH559> to Gedaliah<WH1436> in Mizpah<WH4709> secretly <WH5643>saying,<WH559> Let me go,<WH3212> I pray you, and I will slay<WH5221> Ishmael<WH3458> the son<WH1121> of Nethaniah,<WH5418> and no<WH3808> man<WH376> shall know<WH3045> it: why<WH4100> should he slay<WH5221> you, that all<WH3605> the Jews<WH3064> which are gathered<WH6908> to you should be scattered,<WH6327> and the remnant<WH7611> in Judah<WH3063> perish?<WH6>

But Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> said<WH559> to Johanan<WH3110> the son<WH1121> of Kareah,<WH7143> You shall not do<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing:<WH1697> for you speak<WH1696> falsely<WH8267> of Ishmael.<WH3458>
